title: Current magnetic field and number of loops

content.question: The students insert the magnetic field probe along the axis of the solenoid at the midpoint of the solenoid. The solenoid is connected to the power supply, and measurements are recorded for the magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the magnetic field at that location as a function of the current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> passing through it. The data are taken for five different power supply settings, and the plot of the data is shown in the graph. Which of the following is correct for the total number of loops for this solenoid?

choices.label: The number of loops cannot be determined without knowing the radius of the solenoid.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
